00099 typedef unsigned long xnarch_cpumask_t;
00100 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         XNARCH_NR_CPUS
00101 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            ((1<<xnarch_num_online_cpus()) - 1)
00102 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        ((mask) |= 1 << (cpu))
00103 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      ((mask) &= 1 << (cpu))
00104 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          ((mask) = 0UL)
00105 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      (!!((mask) & (1 << (cpu))))
00106 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) ((dst) = (src1) & (src2))
00107 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  ((mask1) == (mask2))
00108 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          ((mask) == 0UL)
00109 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       (1 << (cpu)) 
00110 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           (ffnz(mask))
00111 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              (~0UL)
00112 
00113 #define xnarch_ullmod(ull,uld,rem)   ((*rem) = ((ull) % (uld)))
00114 #define xnarch_uldivrem(ull,uld,rem) ((u_long)xnarch_ulldiv((ull),(uld),(rem)))
00115 #define xnarch_uldiv(ull, d)         xnarch_uldivrem(ull, d, NULL)
00116 #define xnarch_ulmod(ull, d)         ({ u_long _rem;                    \
00117                                         xnarch_uldivrem(ull,d,&_rem); _rem; })
00118 
00119 static inline int xnarch_imuldiv(int i, int mult, int div)
00120 {
00121     unsigned long long ull = (unsigned long long) (unsigned) i * (unsigned) mult;
00122     return ull / (unsigned) div;
00123 }
00124 
00125 static inline unsigned long long __xnarch_ullimd(unsigned long long ull,
00126                                                  u_long m,
00127                                                  u_long d) {
00128 
00129     unsigned long long mh, ml;
00130     u_long h, l, mlh, mll, qh, r, ql;
00131 
00132     h = ull >> 32; l = ull & 0xffffffff; /* Split ull. */
00133     mh = (unsigned long long) h * m;
00134     ml = (unsigned long long) l * m;
00135     mlh = ml >> 32; mll = ml & 0xffffffff; /* Split ml. */
00136     mh += mlh;
00137     qh = mh / d;
00138     r = mh % d;
00139     ml = (((unsigned long long) r) << 32) + mll; /* assemble r and mll */
00140     ql = ml / d;
00141 
00142     return (((unsigned long long) qh) << 32) + ql;
00143 }
00144 
00145 static inline long long xnarch_llimd(long long ll, u_long m, u_long d) {
00146     if(ll < 0)
00147         return -__xnarch_ullimd(-ll, m, d);
00148     return __xnarch_ullimd(ll, m, d);
00149 }
00150 
00151 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ullmul(unsigned long m1,
00152                                                unsigned long m2) {
00153     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00154 }
00155 
00156 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00157                                                 unsigned long uld,
00158                                                 unsigned long *rem)
00159 {
00160     if (rem)
00161         *rem = ull % uld;
00162 
00163     return ull / uld;
00164 }

00171 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00172 
00173     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00174     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00175     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00176     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00177     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00178     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00179     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00180     pthread_t thid;
00181     xncompletion_t completion;
00182 
00183     /* The following fields are not used by the Fusion skin, however
00184        they are set by the nucleus. */
00185     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00186     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00187 
00188 } xnarchtcb_t;

00212 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00213 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00214 
00215 {
00216     char *value;
00217 
00218     if (*ptype == NULL)
00219         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00220 
00221     value = getenv(name);
00222 
00223     if (!value)
00224         return -1;
00225 
00226     if (**ptype == 's')
00227         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00228     else if (strstr(*ptype,"int"))
00229         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00230     else if (strstr(*ptype,"long"))
00231         *((u_long *)pvar) = (u_long)atol(value);
00232 
00233     *ptype = NULL;
00234 
00235     return 1;
00236 }
00237 
00238 static int inline xnarch_lock_irq (void) {
00239 
00240     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqlock,1);
00241 }
00242 
00243 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x) {
00244 
00245     extern int uvm_irqpend;
00246 
00247     if (!x && uvm_irqlock)
00248         {
00249         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqpend,0))
00250             uvm_thread_release(&uvm_irqlock);
00251         else
00252             uvm_irqlock = 0;
00253         }
00254 }

00268 int uvm_irqlock = 0;
00269 
00270 int uvm_irqpend = 0;
00271 
00272 void xnarch_sync_irq (void)
00273 
00274 {
00275     if (uvm_irqlock)
00276         uvm_thread_hold(&uvm_irqpend);
00277 }

00340 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00341 
00342     longjmp(uvm_current->rstenv,1);
00343 }
00344 
00345 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00346 
00347 {
00348     struct sigaction sa;
00349     int err;
00350 
00351     if (geteuid() !=0)
00352         {
00353         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges.\n");
00354         exit(1);
00355         }
00356 
00357     err = __fusion_sys_init();
00358 
00359     if (err)
00360         {
00361         fprintf(stderr,"sys_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00362         exit(2);
00363         }
00364 
00365     err = __fusion_skin_init();
00366 
00367     if (err)
00368         {
00369         fprintf(stderr,"skin_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00370         exit(3);
00371         }
00372 
00373     err = __fusion_user_init();
00374 
00375     if (err)
00376         {
00377         fprintf(stderr,"user_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00378         exit(4);
00379         }
00380 
00381     /* Lock all the memory space which has been allocated from the
00382        user initialization code. We leave MCL_FUTURE in the hands of
00383        the user, since use of mapped I/O memory might require
00384        decoupling the locking operations as follows:
00385        mlockall(MCL_CURRENT) + mmap() + mlockall(MCL_FUTURE). */
00386     mlockall(MCL_CURRENT);
00387 
00388     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00389     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00390     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00391     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00392 
00393     for (;;)
00394         uvm_thread_idle(&uvm_irqlock);
00395 
00396     __fusion_user_exit();
00397     __fusion_skin_exit();
00398     __fusion_sys_exit();
00399 
00400     exit(0);
00401 }
00402 
00403 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00432 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE

00434 extern void *uvm_timer_handle;
00435 
00436 xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00437 
00438 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_root;
00439 
00440 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_current;
00441 
00442 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00443     unsigned long nstick;
00444     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00445     xncompletion_t completion;
00446 };
00447 
00448 /*
00449  * NOTE: System-level shadow priorities underlying the UVM threads are
00450  * defined as follows:
00451  *
00452  * - uvm-root = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO)
00453  * - uvm-<user> = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1
00454  * - uvm-timer = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2
00455  */
00456 
00457 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00458 
00459 {
00460     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00461     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00462     struct sched_param param;
00463     unsigned long nstick;
00464     long err;
00465 
00466     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2;
00467     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00468 
00469     /* Copy the following values laid into our parent's stack before
00470        it is unblocked from the completion by uvm_thread_create(). */
00471     tickhandler = p->tickhandler;
00472     nstick = p->nstick;
00473 
00474     uvm_thread_create("uvm-timer",NULL,&p->completion,&uvm_timer_handle);
00475 
00476     err = uvm_thread_barrier(); /* Wait for start. */
00477 
00478     if (!err)
00479         err = uvm_thread_set_periodic(0,nstick);
00480 
00481     if (err)
00482         pthread_exit((void *)err);
00483 
00484     for (;;)
00485         {
00486         if (uvm_thread_wait_period() == -EWOULDBLOCK) /* Timer killed? */
00487             break;
00488 
00489         xnarch_sync_irq();
00490         tickhandler();
00491         }
00492 
00493     pthread_exit(NULL);
00494 }
00495 
00496 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00497                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00498 {
00499     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00500     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00501     pthread_t thid;
00502     int err;
00503 
00504     if (nstick == 0) /* UVM does not provide oneshot timing. */
00505         return -ENODEV;
00506 
00507     /* However, if oneshot timing is available at system level, use it
00508        so that we can provide a better resolution for virtual machine
00509        ticks. Otherwise, ask for plain periodic mode, hoping that the
00510        period given will be compatible with Linux's own requirements
00511        wrt its jiffy-based timer. */
00512 
00513 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER
00514     err = uvm_timer_start(0);
00515 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00516     err = uvm_timer_start(nstick);
00517 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00518 
00519     if (err)
00520         return err;
00521 
00522     parms.nstick = nstick;
00523     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00524     parms.completion.syncflag = 0;
00525     parms.completion.pid = -1;
00526 
00527     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00528     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00529     pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00530 
00531     err = uvm_thread_sync(&parms.completion);
00532 
00533     if (err == 0)
00534         uvm_thread_start(uvm_timer_handle);
00535 
00536     return err;
00537 }
00538

00540 }
00541 
00542 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00543 }

00545 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00546                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00547 {
00548     uvm_current = in_tcb;
00549     uvm_thread_activate(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00550 }
00551 
00552 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00553                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00554 {
00555     uvm_current = next_tcb;
00556     uvm_thread_cancel(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00557 }
00558 
00559 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00560 
00561 {
00562     uvm_thread_cancel(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00563 }
00564 
00565 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00566                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00567                                          const char *name)
00568 {
00569     struct sched_param param;
00570     int err;
00571 
00572     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00573     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00574     err = uvm_system_info(&uvm_info);
00575 
00576     if (err)
00577         {
00578         fprintf(stderr,"UVM init failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00579         exit(1);
00580         }
00581 
00582     uvm_thread_shadow("uvm-root",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00583     tcb->name = name;
00584     uvm_root = uvm_current = tcb;
00585 }
00586 
00587 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00588 
00589 {
00590     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00591     struct sched_param param;
00592     long err;
00593 
00594     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00595         {
00596         param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1;
00597         sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00598         uvm_thread_create(tcb->name,tcb,&tcb->completion,&tcb->khandle);
00599         err = uvm_thread_barrier();     /* Wait for start. */
00600         if (err)
00601             pthread_exit((void *)err);
00602         }
00603 
00604     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00605 
00606     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00607 
00608     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00609 
00610     pthread_exit(NULL);
00611 }
00612 
00613 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00614                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00615                                        void *cookie,
00616                                        int imask,
00617                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00618                                        char *name)
00619 {
00620     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00621 
00622     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00623         {
00624         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00625         return;
00626         }
00627 
00628     tcb->imask = imask;
00629     tcb->entry = entry;
00630     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00631     tcb->thread = thread;
00632     tcb->name = name;
00633     tcb->completion.syncflag = 0;
00634     tcb->completion.pid = -1;
00635 
00636     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00637     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00638     pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00639     uvm_thread_sync(&tcb->completion);
00640 }

00662     splhigh(s);
00663     splexit(!!imask);
00664     return !!s;

00699 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long tsc) {
00700 
00701     nanostime_t ns;
00702     return uvm_timer_tsc2ns(tsc,&ns) ? 0 : ns;
00703 }

00711 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void)
00712 
00713 {
00714     nanotime_t t;
00715     uvm_timer_read(&t);
00716     return t;
00717 }

00731 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00732     fprintf(stderr,"UVM fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00733     fflush(stderr);
00734     exit(99);
00735 }
